intro: Arrabidaea platyphylla var. lasiorrhachis, commonly known as the red sandalwood, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant is notable for its dense, aromatic wood, which is highly valued for its durability and fine grain. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland forested areas. Due to overharvesting, it is also considered a threatened species in some regions.
